medical_history.chief_complaint: Epigastric abdominal pain radiating to the entire upper abdomen.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 days prior to presentation, waking the patient from sleep, and occurring post-prandially. The patient has had several episodes of pain prior, which are becoming more frequent. Associated symptoms include nausea and vomiting. Currently, there is no abdominal pain, but the patient has constipation without blood in stool or other changes in bowel movements. No fevers or chills were reported.
